result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin Robert Ludtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.  Court has no objection to sentence being served in another jurisdiction provided the Defendant can make the appropriate arrangements.
Consecutive to: Any sentence currently being served.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin Robert Ludtke

defendant.name: Ludtke, Dustin Robert
defendant.address: 703 East Tamarac Dr., West Bend, WI 53095

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 10:50 AM Defendant Dustin Robert Ludtke in court with attorney Scott M Engstrom, both appearing in person.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per ADA:  Resolution recited with argued terms on SEH.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1 (Retail Theft):  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct 2 DRI.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Engstrom - argues for lesser Co jail time.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  No practical method for the merchant to be repaid with resolution offered.  15 days WCJ imposed consecutive to any sentence currently being served, GT and Huber with 2 days TS credit; no objection to being served in another jurisdiction provided arrangements can be made; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP, Rest of $26 be paid; DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Scott M Engstrom in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Engstrom-defendant is currently in the Washington County Jail-request plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:45 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Scott M Engstrom in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Engstrom-has not had contact with the defendant-defendant is currently in custody. Court sets matter for status in February.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:15 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Britteny LaFond for Attorney Scott M Engstrom in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty LaFond - just found out that Def is currently in the Washington Co Jail.  STC rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 09:25 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant Dustin Robert Ludtke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $2000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:45 am.
